result.execSummary:
The defendant Keaton Timothy Brueggeman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence w/held probation 2 years - fine/costs $748.50 - AODA and any follow thru - absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use w/o valid Rx. and count 2 is dismissed and read-in.

miscConds.notes: Fine $498.50   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Surcharge $250.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Absolute sobriety/No alcohol/drug use without valid Rx.
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations

records.addlTxt: Modification to Conditions of Probation - credit to be applied effective 2/22/17

Defendant Keaton Timothy Brueggeman in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea of NC entered by DE.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty count 1.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 2 years - fine/costs $748.50 - AODA and any follow thru - absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use w/o valid Rx. and count 2 is dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Keaton Timothy Brueggeman in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE waived prelim.  Court advised DE as to his rights to a prelim.  Court finds defendant has freely waived prelim - finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Acknowledged receipt of information

Defendant Keaton Timothy Brueggeman in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement being reached.  Time limits for preliminary hearing were previously waived, Atty McLaughlin states preliminary hearing will be waived at next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
